commit.message:
configure.in: Handle --enable-threads on FreeBSD.

        * configure.in: Handle --enable-threads on FreeBSD.
        * configure: Rebuit.

From-SVN: r29403

files.patch:
@@ -1,3 +1,8 @@
+Tue Sep 14 04:01:46 1999  Loren Rittle  <ljrittle@acm.org>
+
+	* configure.in: Handle --enable-threads on FreeBSD.
+	* configure: Rebuit.
+
 Tue Sep 14 03:58:44 1999  Andreas Jaeger  <aj@arthur.rhein-neckar.de>
 
         * configure.in: Add crtbeginS.o, crtendS.o for mips-linux; add

@@ -3735,6 +3735,12 @@ for machine in $build $host $target; do
 		gas=yes
 		gnu_ld=yes
 		stabs=yes
+		case x${enable_threads} in
+		xyes | xpthreads | xposix)
+			thread_file='posix'
+			tmake_file="${tmake_file} t-openbsd-thread"
+			;;
+		esac
 		;;
 	i[34567]86-*-freebsd*)
 		tm_file=i386/freebsd.h
@@ -6294,15 +6300,15 @@ fi
 
 
         echo $ac_n "checking for strerror in -lcposix""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6298: checking for strerror in -lcposix" >&5
+echo "configure:6304: checking for strerror in -lcposix" >&5
 ac_lib_var=`echo cposix'_'strerror | sed 'y%./+-%__p_%'`
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_lib_$ac_lib_var'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   ac_save_LIBS="$LIBS"
 LIBS="-lcposix  $LIBS"
 cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 6306 "configure"
+#line 6312 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 /* Override any gcc2 internal prototype to avoid an error.  */
 /* We use char because int might match the return type of a gcc2
@@ -6313,7 +6319,7 @@ int main() {
 strerror()
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:6317: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:6323: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   eval "ac_cv_lib_$ac_lib_var=yes"
 else
@@ -6336,12 +6342,12 @@ fi
   
 
 echo $ac_n "checking for working const""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6340: checking for working const" >&5
+echo "configure:6346: checking for working const" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_c_const'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 6345 "configure"
+#line 6351 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 
 int main() {
@@ -6390,7 +6396,7 @@ ccp = (char const *const *) p;
 
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:6394: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
+if { (eval echo configure:6400: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   ac_cv_c_const=yes
 else
@@ -6411,21 +6417,21 @@ EOF
 fi
 
 echo $ac_n "checking for inline""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6415: checking for inline" >&5
+echo "configure:6421: checking for inline" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_c_inline'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   ac_cv_c_inline=no
 for ac_kw in inline __inline__ __inline; do
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 6422 "configure"
+#line 6428 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 
 int main() {
 } $ac_kw foo() {
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:6429: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
+if { (eval echo configure:6435: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   ac_cv_c_inline=$ac_kw; break
 else
@@ -6451,12 +6457,12 @@ EOF
 esac
 
 echo $ac_n "checking for off_t""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6455: checking for off_t" >&5
+echo "configure:6461: checking for off_t" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_type_off_t'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 6460 "configure"
+#line 6466 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <sys/types.h>
 #if STDC_HEADERS
@@ -6484,12 +6490,12 @@ EOF
 fi
 
 echo $ac_n "checking for size_t""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6488: checking for size_t" >&5
+echo "configure:6494: checking for size_t" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_type_size_t'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 6493 "configure"
+#line 6499 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <sys/types.h>
 #if STDC_HEADERS
@@ -6519,19 +6525,19 @@ fi
 # The Ultrix 4.2 mips builtin alloca declared by alloca.h only works
 # for constant arguments.  Useless!
 echo $ac_n "checking for working alloca.h""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6523: checking for working alloca.h" >&5
+echo "configure:6529: checking for working alloca.h" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_header_alloca_h'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 6528 "configure"
+#line 6534 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <alloca.h>
 int main() {
 char *p = alloca(2 * sizeof(int));
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:6535: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:6541: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   ac_cv_header_alloca_h=yes
 else
@@ -6552,12 +6558,12 @@ EOF
 fi
 
 echo $ac_n "checking for alloca""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6556: checking for alloca" >&5
+echo "configure:6562: checking for alloca" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_func_alloca_works'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 6561 "configure"
+#line 6567 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 
 #ifdef __GNUC__
@@ -6585,7 +6591,7 @@ int main() {
 char *p = (char *) alloca(1);
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:6589: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:6595: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   ac_cv_func_alloca_works=yes
 else
@@ -6617,12 +6623,12 @@ EOF
 
 
 echo $ac_n "checking whether alloca needs Cray hooks""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6621: checking whether alloca needs Cray hooks" >&5
+echo "configure:6627: checking whether alloca needs Cray hooks" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_os_cray'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 6626 "configure"
+#line 6632 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #if defined(CRAY) && ! defined(CRAY2)
 webecray
@@ -6647,12 +6653,12 @@ echo "$ac_t""$ac_cv_os_cray" 1>&6
 if test $ac_cv_os_cray = yes; then
 for ac_func in _getb67 GETB67 getb67; do
   echo $ac_n "checking for $ac_func""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6651: checking for $ac_func" >&5
+echo "configure:6657: checking for $ac_func" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_func_$ac_func'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 6656 "configure"
+#line 6662 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 /* System header to define __stub macros and hopefully few prototypes,
     which can conflict with char $ac_func(); below.  */
@@ -6675,7 +6681,7 @@ $ac_func();
 
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:6679: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:6685: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   eval "ac_cv_func_$ac_func=yes"
 else
@@ -6702,15 +6708,15 @@ done
 fi
 
 echo $ac_n "checking stack direction for C alloca""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6706: checking stack direction for C alloca" >&5
+echo "configure:6712: checking stack direction for C alloca" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_c_stack_direction'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   if test "$cross_compiling" = yes; then
   ac_cv_c_stack_direction=0
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 6714 "configure"
+#line 6720 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 find_stack_direction ()
 {
@@ -6729,7 +6735,7 @@ main ()
   exit (find_stack_direction() < 0);
 }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:6733: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext} && (./conftest; exit) 2>/dev/null
+if { (eval echo configure:6739: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext} && (./conftest; exit) 2>/dev/null
 then
   ac_cv_c_stack_direction=1
 else
@@ -6754,17 +6760,17 @@ for ac_hdr in unistd.h
 do
 ac_safe=`echo "$ac_hdr" | sed 'y%./+-%__p_%'`
 echo $ac_n "checking for $ac_hdr""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6758: checking for $ac_hdr" >&5
+echo "configure:6764: checking for $ac_hdr" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_header_$ac_safe'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 6763 "configure"
+#line 6769 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <$ac_hdr>
 EOF
 ac_try="$ac_cpp conftest.$ac_ext >/dev/null 2>conftest.out"
-{ (eval echo configure:6768: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }
+{ (eval echo configure:6774: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }
 ac_err=`grep -v '^ *+' conftest.out | grep -v "^conftest.${ac_ext}\$"`
 if test -z "$ac_err"; then
   rm -rf conftest*
@@ -6793,12 +6799,12 @@ done
 for ac_func in getpagesize
 do
 echo $ac_n "checking for $ac_func""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6797: checking for $ac_func" >&5
+echo "configure:6803: checking for $ac_func" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_func_$ac_func'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 6802 "configure"
+#line 6808 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 /* System header to define __stub macros and hopefully few prototypes,
     which can conflict with char $ac_func(); below.  */
@@ -6821,7 +6827,7 @@ $ac_func();
 
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:6825: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:6831: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   eval "ac_cv_func_$ac_func=yes"
 else
@@ -6846,15 +6852,15 @@ fi
 done
 
 echo $ac_n "checking for working mmap""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6850: checking for working mmap" >&5
+echo "configure:6856: checking for working mmap" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_func_mmap_fixed_mapped'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   if test "$cross_compiling" = yes; then
   ac_cv_func_mmap_fixed_mapped=no
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 6858 "configure"
+#line 6864 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 
 /* Thanks to Mike Haertel and Jim Avera for this test.
@@ -6994,7 +7000,7 @@ main()
 }
 
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:6998: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext} && (./conftest; exit) 2>/dev/null
+if { (eval echo configure:7004: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext} && (./conftest; exit) 2>/dev/null
 then
   ac_cv_func_mmap_fixed_mapped=yes
 else
@@ -7022,17 +7028,17 @@ unistd.h sys/param.h
 do
 ac_safe=`echo "$ac_hdr" | sed 'y%./+-%__p_%'`
 echo $ac_n "checking for $ac_hdr""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:7026: checking for $ac_hdr" >&5
+echo "configure:7032: checking for $ac_hdr" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_header_$ac_safe'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 7031 "configure"
+#line 7037 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <$ac_hdr>
 EOF
 ac_try="$ac_cpp conftest.$ac_ext >/dev/null 2>conftest.out"
-{ (eval echo configure:7036: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }
+{ (eval echo configure:7042: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }
 ac_err=`grep -v '^ *+' conftest.out | grep -v "^conftest.${ac_ext}\$"`
 if test -z "$ac_err"; then
   rm -rf conftest*
@@ -7062,12 +7068,12 @@ done
 strdup __argz_count __argz_stringify __argz_next
 do
 echo $ac_n "checking for $ac_func""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:7066: checking for $ac_func" >&5
+echo "configure:7072: checking for $ac_func" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_func_$ac_func'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 7071 "configure"
+#line 7077 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 /* System header to define __stub macros and hopefully few prototypes,
     which can conflict with char $ac_func(); below.  */
@@ -7090,7 +7096,7 @@ $ac_func();
 
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:7094: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:7100: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   eval "ac_cv_func_$ac_func=yes"
 else
@@ -7119,12 +7125,12 @@ done
      for ac_func in stpcpy
 do
 echo $ac_n "checking for $ac_func""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:7123: checking for $ac_func" >&5
+echo "configure:7129: checking for $ac_func" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_func_$ac_func'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 7128 "configure"
+#line 7134 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 /* System header to define __stub macros and hopefully few prototypes,
     which can conflict with char $ac_func(); below.  */
@@ -7147,7 +7153,7 @@ $ac_func();
 
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:7151: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:7157: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   eval "ac_cv_func_$ac_func=yes"
 else
@@ -7181,19 +7187,19 @@ EOF
 
    if test $ac_cv_header_locale_h = yes; then
     echo $ac_n "checking for LC_MESSAGES""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:7185: checking for LC_MESSAGES" >&5
+echo "configure:7191: checking for LC_MESSAGES" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'am_cv_val_LC_MESSAGES'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 7190 "configure"
+#line 7196 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <locale.h>
 int main() {
 return LC_MESSAGES
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:7197: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:7203: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   am_cv_val_LC_MESSAGES=yes
 else
@@ -7214,7 +7220,7 @@ EOF
     fi
   fi
    echo $ac_n "checking whether NLS is requested""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:7218: checking whether NLS is requested" >&5
+echo "configure:7224: checking whether NLS is requested" >&5
         # Check whether --enable-nls or --disable-nls was given.
 if test "${enable_nls+set}" = set; then
   enableval="$enable_nls"
@@ -7234,7 +7240,7 @@ fi
 EOF
 
       echo $ac_n "checking whether included gettext is requested""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:7238: checking whether included gettext is requested" >&5
+echo "configure:7244: checking whether included gettext is requested" >&5
       # Check whether --with-included-gettext or --without-included-gettext was given.
 if test "${with_included_gettext+set}" = set; then
   withval="$with_included_gettext"
@@ -7253,17 +7259,17 @@ fi
 
 	ac_safe=`echo "libintl.h" | sed 'y%./+-%__p_%'`
 echo $ac_n "checking for libintl.h""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:7257: checking for libintl.h" >&5
+echo "configure:7263: checking for libintl.h" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_header_$ac_safe'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 7262 "configure"
+#line 7268 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <libintl.h>
 EOF
 ac_try="$ac_cpp conftest.$ac_ext >/dev/null 2>conftest.out"
-{ (eval echo configure:7267: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }
+{ (eval echo configure:7273: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }
 ac_err=`grep -v '^ *+' conftest.out | grep -v "^conftest.${ac_ext}\$"`
 if test -z "$ac_err"; then
   rm -rf conftest*
@@ -7280,19 +7286,19 @@ fi
 if eval "test \"`echo '$ac_cv_header_'$ac_safe`\" = yes"; then
   echo "$ac_t""yes" 1>&6
   echo $ac_n "checking for gettext in libc""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:7284: checking for gettext in libc" >&5
+echo "configure:7290: checking for gettext in libc" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'gt_cv_func_gettext_libc'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 7289 "configure"
+#line 7295 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <libintl.h>
 int main() {
 return (int) gettext ("")
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:7296: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:7302: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   gt_cv_func_gettext_libc=yes
 else
@@ -7308,15 +7314,15 @@ echo "$ac_t""$gt_cv_func_gettext_libc" 1>&6
 
 	   if test "$gt_cv_func_gettext_libc" != "yes"; then
 	     echo $ac_n "checking for bindtextdomain in -lintl""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:7312: checking for bindtextdomain in -lintl" >&5
+echo "configure:7318: checking for bindtextdomain in -lintl" >&5
 ac_lib_var=`echo intl'_'bindtextdomain | sed 'y%./+-%__p_%'`
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_lib_$ac_lib_var'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   ac_save_LIBS="$LIBS"
 LIBS="-lintl  $LIBS"
 cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 7320 "configure"
+#line 7326 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 /* Override any gcc2 internal prototype to avoid an error.  */
 /* We use char because int might match the return type of a gcc2
@@ -7327,7 +7333,7 @@ int main() {
 bindtextdomain()
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:7331: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:7337: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   eval "ac_cv_lib_$ac_lib_var=yes"
 else
@@ -7343,20 +7349,20 @@ fi
 if eval "test \"`echo '$ac_cv_lib_'$ac_lib_var`\" = yes"; then
   echo "$ac_t""yes" 1>&6
   echo $ac_n "checking for gettext in libintl""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:7347: checking for gettext in libintl" >&5
+echo "configure:7353: checking for gettext in libintl" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'gt_cv_func_gettext_libintl'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   echo $ac_n "checking for gettext in -lintl""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:7352: checking for gettext in -lintl" >&5
+echo "configure:7358: checking for gettext in -lintl" >&5
